resources.string: يود المطورون أن يشكروا المساهمين على مكتبات المصدر المفتوح أو المكتبات العامة التالية التي يمكن استخدامها داخل هذا المنتج:
رخصة جنو العمومية العامة تعديل مع توفير للاستخدام التجاري
المحاكاة كان المستخدمة مؤخرا وقد انتهى.
تصفح تطبيقات صنفت التي كتبها أذونات الأمان
fx [الملف مستكشف]: ملف مدير مع اختياري الجذر، شبكة (سه، بروتوكول نقل الملفات، الصغيرة والمتوسطة) و سحابة التخزين (جوجل محرك الأقراص، sugarsync، صندوق الإسقاط، مربع) القدرات.
هذا التطبيق لا يطلب أي امتيازات.
هذا التطبيق لا يملك أي الخدمات.
مشاهدة كل التطبيقات باستخدام هذا الإذن المجموعة
حدد عنصر واحد أو أكثر لأرشفة وحاول مرة أخرى. اضغط على \"مساعدة\" زر للحصول على معلومات حول كيفية تحديد الملفات.
هذا الأرشيف يتم تشفير. fx plus يلزم استخدام التشفير الميزات.
كلمة المرور وتأكيد كلمة المرور غير متطابقة.

"هل أنت متأكد أنك تريد أن مجموعة \"%s\" كما الافتراضي الخاص بك صوت التنبيه؟
هذا الصوت ستقام لجميع أجهزة الإنذار الذي لم يكن لديك مخصص صوت التنبيه تكوين."

"هل أنت متأكد أنك تريد أن مجموعة \"%s\" كما الافتراضي الخاص بك إشعار الصوت؟
هذا الإخطار ستقام عندما طلب يجب أن بإبلاغكم حدث (ما لم تطبيق تم تكوين للعب مخصص إشعار)."

"Are you sure you want to set \"%s\" as your default phone ringtone?
This ringtone will be played when you receive an incoming call from any contact that does not have a custom ringtone configured."

To use your Box account with FX, you will now be directed to a browser to login and/or confirm access by FX to your Box account. Press the checkmark button below to continue.

"Unable to connect.
The device must be running a Bluetooth FTP server in order to browse files (Bluetooth FTP is not enabled by default on most computers/devices). If you are not familiar with transferring files via Bluetooth, it is recommended that you try sending files via Bluetooth Push rather than using Bluetooth FTP. View the help for more information.
If Bluetooth FTP is in fact enabled on the target device, try connecting again."
Bluetooth is off. To display paired devices, enable Bluetooth by pressing the button above.
This device is currently discoverable by other Bluetooth devices. To pair another device with this device, have the other Bluetooth-enabled device search for discoverable devices.
Searching for devices. Make sure the other device is \"Discoverable\".
Bluetooth must be enabled to discover new devices.
Bluetooth must be enabled to make this device discoverable.

You must enable Bluetooth before performing this operation.

THIS PACKAGE APPEARS TO BE A CORE SYSTEM PACKAGE. It is strongly recommended that you DO NOT DISABLE this package. Proceed at your own risk.

"Are you certain you want to disable the package \"%s\"?
Disabling critical system packages can cause the device to work improperly or become entirely non-functional. Please be absolutely certain that this package is safe to disable before proceeding."

"This is a user-installed package. It is strongly recommended that you simply uninstall it rather than disabling it. User-installed packages which are disabled may not be re-enabled from Android's built-in app management utility. If you disable this package, you must use FX (or another third-party utility) to re-enable it before it can be used or uninstalled."
Check this box to confirm this action.
"WARNING: Disabling an application's services may cause it to behave incorrectly and/or crash."

The following service(s) will be enabled:

Composite checksums are calculated using a non-standardized formula of digesting a directory list and the checksums of its contained files. A composite checksum will inform you if one structure of files/folders is equivalent to another. This equality of composite checksums is only valid between identical versions of FX.

"Select one or more items to download and try again.
Press the \"Help\" button for information about how to select files."
No download folder has been configured or the folder cannot be written to. Select a download folder in the Tools->Settings menu.
To use your Dropbox account with FX, you will now be directed to a browser to login and/or confirm access by FX to your Dropbox account. Press the checkmark button below to continue.
Unable to start the requested application / activity.
This Android Package cannot be opened directly. This typically occurs if the package is located in a protected directory.

"Allowing a filesystem to be remounted will allow you to mount it read-only or read-write.
You should only enable this feature on filesystems which are normally mounted read-only.
Enabling this feature on filesystems which require read-write access (such as /data or /cache) will cause your device to malfunction."
I understand that this may be very dangerous if misused.

If you are setting up Google Drive for the first time with this account, you will be directed to a screen asking your consent to use FX with Google Docs (Google Drive is the successor to Google Docs). Press the checkmark button below to continue.
Do not show this tip again.
The selected item has been hidden. It will only be shown when the \"show hidden\" option is selected in the options menu.
You can also add shortcuts to the launcher homescreen from within FX. Just long press on a folder or file, select \"Add Bookmark\" and then choose \"Launcher Shortcut\".
In addition to enabling \"Multiple Select\" mode, you can select multiple items by swiping your finger horizontally across items.

"You are now browsing the Android filesystem as a non-root user.
If you need to perform filesystem operations as root, you can download the free FX Root Add-On Module from the Google Play Store.
Please note: the root module requires root access and is recommended ONLY for developers and knowledgeable enthusiasts."
Root access is not enabled: if root is desired, please download the FREE root access module.

This \"System Status\" screen shows detailed technical information about the inner workings of FX. Most users will not find this screen useful, and there is never a need to manually interact with this screen. It exists largely for purposes of testing and providing support / troubleshooting of the application.
Do not show this warning again.

This search is being conducted over a network connection. This search will examine the name and/or details of every file/folder within this location, which may take some time. Searching in this manner is not recommended unless the server is attached to your local network. Public servers will often prohibit this type of searching.

This problem can be worked around if you have superuser access. Please refer to websites/forums related to your specific device for information. You may be able to install the free NextApp SDFix application to work around this issue.

"This device is running Android 4.4 or later and appears to have both an internal storage area and external storage (e.g., a MicroSD card).
Google imposed new restrictions in the Android 4.4 KitKat Update: applications that you install yourself are no longer permitted to write to the \"secondary external\" storage (the MicroSD card).
Applications installed by Google, the device manufacturer, and/or your mobile carrier are exempt from this restriction. Only applications you choose to install are restricted.
FX provides a potential workaround for this issue using an alternate Android API. If you wish to use the workaround, you must manually enable it in the Settings, in the \"File Management\" section. The workaround provides limited capabilities, is not supported on all devices, and may not function at all with future Android releases.
Some devices may not enforce this restriction, and others may have a means of disabling it. If you find yourself unable to write to your external SD card, please contact either your mobile carrier or device manufacturer's support."
YOUR SD CARD MAY NOW BE READ-ONLY.

"This device is running Android 5.0 or later and appears to have both an internal storage area and external storage (e.g., a MicroSD card).
On most Android 5 and later devices, the MicroSD card is not automatically writable by user-installed apps.
To enable write access, open the MicroSD card, tap the menu and select \"Enable Write Access\"."
YOUR SD CARD MAY BE READ-ONLY.
Press the back key again to exit.

In Android 4.4/KitKat, Google disabled the ability for applications (other than those provided by Google, your device manufacturer, and/or your carrier) to write to \"secondary storage\" locations, such as MicroSD cards. This workaround may restore some (but not all) functionality by using an alternate interface to manipulate data on external media. This setting should not be enabled unless you have specifically had problems writing to external media and absolutely require a workaround.
Check this box if you have read the disclaimer and want to proceed with enabling this setting.
Use workaround method to write to MicroSD card when required

"We are sorry for the inconvenience, but due to a bug in Android itself, you must uninstall this application and re-download it from the Android market.
This problem WILL *NOT* OCCUR EVERY TIME you update FX.
The reason for the problem occurring is that we had to make a change that isn't handled properly by the Android application updater. If you're a technical sort of person, you can learn more by searching for \"Android issue 14074\" at http://google.com.
No networking functionality will be available, no user preferences will be saved, and other features of FX may fail to operate as expected until the product is uninstalled and reinstalled.
Our apologies again for this very frustrating issue."

"We strongly recommend you uninstall the application immediately and then download it again from the market.
Are you sure you want to continue using the application as-is?"

"This filesystem is not currently on the list of read-only filesystems which are allowed to be remounted as read-write. Would you like to add this filesystem to the list?
You may later remove filesystems from this list using the \"Filesystems\" option in the menu."

Remounting filesystems as writable can be extremely dangerous if you are not technically skilled and very familiar with how the Android operating system operates. Please use extreme caution and be certain to remount this filesystem as read-only when you are finished.

A confirmation dialog will be displayed to allow root access. Using a Password or PIN for authentication will provide increased safety.

"The entered password was not valid.

You are about to perform operations as the root user. Making incorrect modifications may cause the device to become unstable or entirely non-functional.

"USING ROOT ACCESS CAN BE EXTREMELY DANGEROUS.
The root access module is intended for software developers and knowledgeable enthusiasts only. Modifying your device using root access can render it unstable, unreliable, or entirely unusable. Your device's manufacturer may or may not warrant the device against defects if it has been modified using root access.
YOU SHOULD NOT use this module UNLESS you have the knowledge and materials necessary to reflash your device's firmware should it happen to enter an unrecoverable state. Do not rely on your devices's manufacturer, carrier, or retailer to provide such services to you—they may not be able to do so.
This module requires that you already have the ability to perform operations as the root user. This module WILL NOT grant you root access if such access has not already been enabled on the device using other software."
You must first check the \"I understand the risk\" checkbox before you press the \"OK\" button.

Share your clipboard with the other device.
Sharing the clipboard enables you to copy and paste items directly between devices.

"You must be connected to a Wi-Fi network or have enabled cellular access in order to start sharing.
If desired, cellular access may be enabled from the Network section of the Sharing Settings menu.
Cellular sharing may not be possible if your carrier blocks incoming connections (and most carriers will block access)."

If you grant administrator access, the other device will have full control over this device while they are connected. For security and privacy reasons, this is not recommended unless you own both devices.
"Access your files and media using a computer's web browser or via WebDAV."
Web access is not available because the device is not connected to a Wi-Fi network.

"The private key file does not appear to be of a supported format. Private keys must be in the OpenSSH format. The private key file should start with one of the following two lines:
-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY----- -----BEGIN DSA PRIVATE KEY-----
Attempting to connect using this private key will fail."

"The RSA key provided by the host \"%1$s\" is different from the one provided on a previous connection. This may be the result of a serious security attack. A third-party could be attempting to intercept your connection to this host in order to acquire access to the host themselves. Alternatively, it could simply be that the server has been reinstalled or reconfigured since the last time you connected. Please make absolutely certain that this host key change is legitimate and that the new host key fingerprint is correct.
The fingerprint of the key on record is: \"%2$s\".
The host is now providing a key with a fingerprint of: \"%3$s\".
Check the box above and press \"OK\" if you want to continue connecting and to use this new key for all future connections to this host."
Check this box only if you can confirm this to be a legitimate key change.

"The authenticity of the host \"%1$s\" cannot be established.
The RSA key fingerprint is \"%2$s\". Press \"OK\" if you want to continue connecting and to use this key for all future connections to this host."
Direct password authentication is not permitted by this server; interactive authentication is required.
WARNING - Protected filesystems remounted with write access:
The selected location is different than the location of this storage. You must select the root directory of this storage, e.g., \"SD Card\".

"In order to write to this storage, you must grant write access to FX.
Press the next button and then use the Android System dialog to navigate to the root of this storage location if you would like write access to it."

"Write access to this storage has been granted.
You may now create new files/folders as well as move, delete, and rename items on this storage.
Any open windows connected to this storage must be closed and reopened before this change will take effect."

"Press \"OK\" to revoke write access privileges from this storage.
Note: you must close any windows using this storage location before the change will take effect."

"Select the symlink target and try again.
Press the \"Help\" button for information about how to select files."

Wallpaper backgrounds, lighter translucent trim elements.
Tap the \"Add-Ons\" item on the home screen to add more features to FX.
The FX Plus add-on enables networking, cloud, music, image, video, and app management capabilities in FX. The FX Plus add-on is a paid app. A 7-day trial is available without purchase.
Got Root? The FX Root add-on enables you to manipulate files as the root user (this requires that you already have root access to your device). The root add-on is free.
Add more features with FX Add-Ons.

"Tap \"Ok\" to exit the tutorial immediately.
You can revisit the tutorial from the main menu on the FX home screen."
The clipboard indicator will appear in the upper-right of the screen.
"Now navigate to the new location where you'd like the files. Then tap the clipboard indicator. Tap paste to move or copy the files to the new location."
To move or copy files, first select them, and then…
To exit split view mode, drag the divider or center location bar to the top or bottom of the screen.
When not in split view mode, drag the location bar at the top of the screen to the bottom to flip between the last two windows.
Drag the location bar at the top of the screen halfway down to open split view mode.
Pinch-to-zoom to make items larger or smaller. In some views, more information will be displayed when you zoom in.
"This tutorial takes about two minutes. You'll get much more out of FX if you read it."
Scroll to the right to continue.
Tap the back button to leave.
The main menu is in the upper-right corner of the screen.
The \"three dots\" main menu is used to access all basic features, like creating new folders, files, and bookmarks, or changing the sort order and display mode.
The menu bar will change when files are selected, allowing you to move, copy, delete, and perform other operations on the selected files.
Select files by swiping horizontally across them.
Alternatively, tap the \"plus\" button in the action bar to touch-select files.
Start a 7-day trial of FX Plus now.
"You're ready to start using FX. You can revisit this tutorial at any time by opening FX Help from the slide-out menu and then visiting the \"View Tutorial\" link."
Tap the close button next to a window to discard it.
Drag outward from the left edge of the screen to open the slide-out menu.
Tap the \"Open Window\" button to create a new window. Long press it to create a copy of the existing window.
You can also tap the \"three lines\" icon in the upper-left corner to open the menu.
The FX Plus add-on enables network, cloud, and media functionality.

Cloud support includes Google Drive, Dropbox, Box, SugarSync, and OneDrive. Connects to FTP (incl. secure), Windows Shares (SMB), and SSH FTP servers. Adds Bluetooth OBEX Push and OBEX FTP support. Media features include image and video browsing as well as music browsing by artist, album, playlist, and track. Includes playlist management and reorganization features.
The root access add-on enables browsing and manipulating files as the root user.
This add-on requires that you already have root access to your phone/tablet. The root access module is intended for software developers and knowledgeable enthusiasts only.
Theme listing could not be loaded.

"Press the \"OK\" button to start a 7-day trial of the FX Plus module.
During the trial, you will be able to access the media and network/cloud features of FX. Once the trial has finished, these features will no longer be available unless you choose to purchase the FX Plus add-on.
The trial will run through %s."
Thank you for trying FX Plus. The trial period has elapsed. FX Plus is available for purchase on the Google Play Store.
WARNING: FX Plus is required for theme support. Themes can also be used with the FX Plus trial.

"A network error occurred communicating with host \"%s\": password authentication is not supported. This problem may be corrected by using either public key authentication or by enabling password authentication on the host. If you are unfamiliar with this issue, browse the web for documentation on \"enabling SSH password authentication\" with respect to the host's operating system."
The host \"%s\" is configured to require SSL certificate reuse for encrypted connections. This feature is unfortunately not supported by the underlying Apache FTP library at the present time.
Access was denied due to an illegal pathname. This type of illegal path (relative reference to parent, i.e. \"..\") may pose a significant security threat.

Access was denied. This device prevents user-installed applications from writing to storage locations other than \"Main Storage\". This restriction was added by Google to Android 4.4 KitKat and affects all installed applications except preloaded applications provided by Google, the device manufacturer, and/or your cellular service provider. You may attempt to work around this issue by enabling the \"KitKat SD Write Workaround\" option in the Settings under \"File Management\".

"Access was denied: write access is not enabled.
By default, user-installed applications are prohibited by Android from writing to storage locations other than \"Main Storage\". You may be able to obtain write access to this storage using the \"Enable Write Access\" feature, available in the menu."
